content: quote: Originally posted by outlaws93: quote: Originally posted by nspreitler: It was a good call not to shoot it down. If it had been a threat I am sure it would have been engaged. We can tell where things like that are going to impact. why?? shoot the damn thing down and dont let nk (a hostile country) complete their tests... Because it wasn't a threat. If it was a threat certainly shoot it down. If they fired a missile that was targeted at us or an ally that would be a threat. A satellite launch with rocket bodies splahing down harmlessly in the ocean is not a threat. Shooting it down is an act of war, and in case you haven't noticed we are a little busy with the other two wars. We don't have the manpower to fight N Korea if they decided to invade the south. Besides, starting a war with N Korea over a satellite launch just isn't worth a single American life.
